title: Government’s Lawyer Urges Justices to Delay Ruling on Census Plan
sub_head: President Trump is seeking to exclude illegal immigrants from count used to apportion congressional seats
body:
WASHINGTON—Several justices suggested Monday that the Supreme Court put off ruling on President Trump’s plan to exclude immigrants in the country illegally from population figures used to apportion congressional seats, after the administration’s lawyer said the government might not be able to assemble the needed data quickly enough to meet January deadlines.
“I think it is very unlikely that the bureau will be able to identify all or substantially all illegal aliens present in the country, anything like the 10 or 11 or 12...
